# setDeviceID(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the I/O hardware device.

## Declaration

```swift
func setDeviceID(_ deviceID: AUAudioObjectID) throws
```

## Parameters

- **deviceID**: The device to set.

## Discussion

- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if the operation failed.

## Discussion



## Configuring the Device

- **deviceID**: Gets the I/O hardware device.
- **canPerformInput**: Determines whether the I/O device can perform input.
- **canPerformOutput**: Determines whether the I/O device can perform output.
- **isInputEnabled**: A flag enabling audio input from the unit.
- **isOutputEnabled**: A flag enabling audio output from the unit.
- **inputHandler**: The block that the output unit will call to notify when input is available.
- **outputProvider**: The block that the output unit will call to get audio to send to the output.
- **deviceInputLatency**: The audio device’s input latency, in seconds.
- **deviceOutputLatency**: The audio devic’s output latency, in seconds.
- **startHardware()**: Starts the audio hardware.
- **stopHardware()**: Stops the audio hardware.
- **AURenderPullInputBlock**: A block to supply audio input to a render block.
